summary: This document is an email chain from March 2016, forwarded in 2019, discussing a meeting request regarding a potential sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein. The initial email, from a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) official, describes a pitch from lawyers representing a victim and outlines the complex legal background, including Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a financier with multiple homes, accused of sex trafficking with dozens of victims, and subject of a 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida USAO.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: One of the lawyers who, along with two others, pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Skinner, as a lawyer, was pitching a case against Epstein on behalf of a victim, indicating an attorney-client relationship with the victim and an adversarial legal stance toward Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a non-prosecution agreement (non-pros) with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Lawyer Pitch to SDNY on Epstein Case
events.description: Lawyers, including Pete Skinner, pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: In March 2016, lawyers including Pete Skinner pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
The pitch involved a victim who claims to have been prostituted by Epstein at age 16, with Epstein alleged to have had dozens of victims.
The email notes the existence of several related civil cases and Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida USAO as complicating factors.
The document is an email chain forwarded in February 2019, indicating ongoing interest or review of the matter years later.
